Articles.Content: I honestly haven't been drawn in by the 1.0 hype. I always thought naming 0.90 a beta version was a bit premature, since there were still elements to be introduced- thus making 0.90 the final alpha, and '1.0' the actual (feature complete) beta version. Since there seems to be no end of complaints regarding the changes, I figure I'll stick in 0.90 for a while and wait for it to blow over. When's 1.1 coming out? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I am...I expect to be on 0.90 for at least another month or two...

i am HEAVILY modded, and use lots of older, almost abandoned mods, so I like to wait for tons more of the mods to get updates...

Also, by waiting, i figure to not have to deal with any fresh bugs...

PLUS, it seems 0.90 has hardly been out very long at all...I only have a few hours playing 0.90, since for the reasons stated above, i have still been playing 0.25 for the first couple months after 0.90 came out... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I still have v0.90 installed. However, I've been devoting my time to the new v1.0.2 instead. At some point this coming week, I'll be hopping back into v0.90 to bring all my Kerbals back home. I'll make a few last notes about the crafts I've built, backup my screenshots... then the rest goes off to the archives.

YES! I still have not installed 1.0.2 ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I had the SATs and didn't want to get distracted.

> 
> Since there seems to be no end of complaints regarding the changes, I figure I'll stick in 0.90 for a while and wait for it to blow over. When's 1.1 coming out? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

This is generally a troubling stance, because I doubt if Squad will ever revert back to the old aerodynamic system. If you do not adapt now, then waiting for v1.1 will only leave you disappointed, because I believe the new aero system will simply be more enhanced--perhaps more forgiving (and I don't know who will win the tug of war) but still, you have to get used to the fact that it requires a different approach now to reach orbit on any world with an atmosphere.

I do have at least two other copies of 0.90 saved, but as far as my main playthrough is concerned I am in 1.0.2. I'm going to try to save my KSP versions from here on out, since I failed to do so since 0.20. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
I have stopped playing 0.90, but I have yet to upgrade to 1.0

Why wait!? The complaints seem to me to be more on the overreacting side. Heck, I hear Regex even gave a complement to 1.0. That's no small feat. And yes, there are problems, as with any release. However, Squad is addressing them.

I'm with you. While I think that "1.0" brings a lot of great new additions, it seems quite rushed and still has a lot of place holders (water, terrain scatter, career). I feel the same with the indecisosphere that is KSP 1.0, 1.0.1 and 1.0.2, so until FAR is updated for 1.0 I'll be playing 0.90-FAR.
